meanings.sent1: The infundibula of the flower guide the nectar to the center.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a metal infundibula to pour the batter into the cake mold.
meanings.sent3: The infundibula of the volcano made it look like a giant flower blooming.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an infundibula, drawing in ideas from all directions.
meanings.sent5: The infundibula of the tornado sucked up everything in its path.

meanings.definition: A small cavity or sac in the body, such as a sinus or follicle.
meanings.sent1: The infundibula in the skin help regulate oil production.
meanings.sent2: The doctor found an infected infundibula during the examination.
meanings.sent3: The infundibula in the body are like tiny storage units for essential fluids.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like an empty infundibula, devoid of any emotion.
meanings.sent5: The infundibula of the lungs expand and contract with each breath.
